Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE
Name: Bottle
Description: Bottle with an ovoid body and a tall and narrow flaring neck with a convex lip. The vessel is covered with a thick brick-red slip that has been burnished, the resulting vertical stripes making the vessel look like Kerma ceramics.
